result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas P McKee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission

Case called at 8:33am[mo]
Defendant Lucas P McKee in court with attorney Michael C. Witt.   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions as set forth in the Criminal Case Settlement.

[which are:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per agent
--absolute sobriety(no alcohol, no controlled substances without valid prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--complete certified batterers' intervention programming per agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to pay statutory costs]

The Court order Mr. McKee to provide a DNA sample to JESO today
The Court directs the cash bond to applied to payment of costs/fees/surcharges

Days credit for time already served:  0  days

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute/ ADA Wambach did prosecute Mr. McKee. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
recess: 8:50am
Defendant's Response to State's Demand for Discovery
Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 11:21 am. 
Defendant Lucas P McKee in court.  ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. McKee verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given
Pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant


The Court requires $150 Cash Bond (already posted), with added conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--no discussion of the case with Shelly Witucki
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
recess 11:24am
